1.quote: A black cat crossing your path signifies that the animal is going somewhere.
1.author: Groucho Marx

2.quote: A friend of mine is into Voodoo Acupuncture. You don't have to go. You'll just be walking down the street and... Ooohh, that's much better.
2.author: Steven Wright

3.quote: A lot of people are afraid of heights. Not me. I'm afraid of widths.
3.author: Steven Wright

4.quote: A possum must be himself, and being himself he is honest.
4.author: Walt Kelly

5.quote: A power so great, it can only be used for Good or Evil!
5.author: Firesign Theatre, The Giant Rat of Summatra

6.quote: All men are mortal. Socrates was mortal. Therefore, all men are Socrates.
6.author: Woody Allen

7.quote: And now for something completely the same.
7.author: Unknown

8.quote: Are you sure you're not an encyclopedia salesman? No, Ma'am. Just a burglar, come to ransack the flat.
8.author: Monty Python

9.quote: As the poet said, Only God can make a tree...probably because it's so hard to figure out how to get the bark on.
9.author: Woody Allen

10.quote: Being Ymor's right-hand man was like being gently flogged to death with scented bootlaces.
10.author: Terry Pratchett, The Colour of Magic

11.quote: Bernard Shaw is an excellent man; he has not an enemy in the world, and none of his friends like him either.
11.author: Oscar Wilde

12.quote: Boy, life takes a long time to live.
12.author: Steven Wright

13.quote: But I always fired into the nearest hill or, failing that, into blackness. I meant no harm; I just liked the explosions. And I was careful never to kill more than I could eat.
13.author: Raoul Duke

15.quote: Comedy, like Medicine, was never meant to be practiced by the general public.
15.author: Unknown

16.quote: Death didn't answer. He was looking at Spold in the same way as a dog looks at a bone, only in this case things were more or less the other way around.
16.author: Terry Pratchett, The Colour of Magic

17.quote: Decorate your home. It gives the illusion that your life is more interesting than it really is.
17.author: C. Schulz

18.quote: Do you think that when they asked George Washington for ID that he just whipped out a quarter?
18.author: Steven Wright

19.quote: Don't take life so serious, son, it ain't nohow permanent.
19.author: Walt Kelly

20.quote: Don't worry about the world coming to an end today. It's already tomorrow in Australia.
20.author: Charles Schulz

21.quote: Early to rise, early to bed, makes a man healthy, wealthy and dead.
21.author: Terry Pratchett, The Light Fantastic

22.quote: Eternal nothingness is fine if you happen to be dressed for it.
22.author: Woody Allen

23.quote: Eternity is a terrible thought. I mean, where's it going to end?
23.author: Tom Stoppard

24.quote: Faster, faster, you fool, you fool!
24.author: Bill Cosby

25.quote: For my birthday I got a humidifier and a de-humidifier... I put them in the same room and let them fight it out.
25.author: Steven Wright

26.quote: From the moment I picked your book up until I put it down I was convulsed with laughter. Some day I intend reading it.
26.author: Groucho Marx, from The Book of Insults

27.quote: God is a comic playing to an audience that's afraid to laugh.
27.author: Unknown

28.quote: He asked me if I knew what time it was...I said yes, but not right now.
28.author: Steven Wright

29.quote: Here's something to think about: How come you never see a headline like `Psychic Wins Lottery'?
29.author: Jay Leno

30.quote: Hey, what do you expect from a culture that *drives* on *parkways* and *parks* on *driveways*?
30.author: Gallagher

31.quote: Humor is a drug which it's the fashion to abuse.
31.author: William Gilbert

32.quote: Humorists always sit at the children's table.
32.author: Woody Allen

33.quote: I am a conscientious man, when I throw rocks at seabirds I leave no tern unstoned.
33.author: Ogden Nash, Everybody's Mind to Me a Kingdom Is

35.quote: I base my fashion taste on what doesn't itch.
35.author: Gilda Radner

36.quote: I bought some used paint. It was in the shape of a house.
36.author: Steven Wright

37.quote: I changed my headlights the other day. I put in strobe lights instead! Now when I drive at night, it looks like everyone else is standing still ...
37.author: Steven Wright

38.quote: I could dance with you till the cows come home. On second thought, I'd rather dance with the cows till you come home.
38.author: Groucho Marx

39.quote: I don't deserve this award, but I have arthritis and I don't deserve that either.
39.author: Jack Benny

40.quote: I don't kill flies, but I like to mess with their minds. I hold them above globes. They freak out and yell Whooa, I'm *way* too high.
40.author: Bruce Baum

41.quote: I don't want to live on in my work, I want to live on in my apartment.
41.author: Woody Allen

42.quote: I finally went to the eye doctor. I got contacts. I only need them to read, so I got flip-ups.
42.author: Steven Wright

43.quote: I got my driver's license photo taken out of focus on purpose. Now when I get pulled over the cop looks at it (moving it nearer and farther, trying to see it clearly)... and says, Here, you can go.
43.author: Steven Wright

44.quote: I got this powdered water...now I don't know what to add.
44.author: Steven Wright

45.quote: I had no shoes and I pitied myself. Then I met a man who had no feet, so I took his shoes.
45.author: Dave Barry

46.quote: I hate it when my foot falls asleep during the day cause that means it's going to be up all night.
46.author: Steven Wright

47.quote: I have a dog; I named him Stay. So when I'd go to call him, I'd say, Here, Stay, here... but he got wise to that. Now when I call him he ignores me and just keeps on typing.
47.author: Steven Wright

48.quote: I have a friend whose a billionaire. He invented Cliff's notes. When I asked him how he got such a great idea he said, Well first I... I just... to make a long story short...
48.author: Steven Wright

49.quote: I have a hobby. I have the world's largest collection of sea shells. I keep it scattered on beaches all over the world. Maybe you've seen some of it.
49.author: Steven Wright

50.quote: I have a map of the United States. It's actual size. I spent last summer folding it. People ask me where I live, and I say, E6.
50.author: Steven Wright

51.quote: I have a rock garden. Last week three of them died.
51.author: Richard Diran

52.quote: I have an existential map. It has You are here written all over it.
52.author: Steven Wright

53.quote: I just got out of the hospital after a speed reading accident. I hit a bookmark.
53.author: Steven Wright

54.quote: I know the answer! The answer lies within the heart of all mankind! The answer is twelve? I think I'm in the wrong building.
54.author: Charles Schulz

55.quote: I look at life as being cruise director on the Titanic. I may not get there, but I'm going first class.
55.author: Art Buchwald

56.quote: I love Saturday morning cartoons, what classic humour! This is what entertainment is all about ... Idiots, explosives and falling anvils.
56.author: Calvin and Hobbes, Bill Watterson

57.quote: I met my latest girl friend in a department store. She was looking at clothes, and I was putting Slinkys on the escalators.
57.author: Steven Wright

58.quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I'll make an exception.
58.author: Groucho Marx

59.quote: I poured spot remover on my dog. Now he's gone.
59.author: Steven Wright

60.quote: I put contact lenses in my dog's eyes. They had little pictures of cats on them. Then I took one out and he ran around in circles.
60.author: Steven Wright

61.quote: I put instant coffee in a microwave and almost went back in time.
61.author: Steven Wright

62.quote: I saw a subliminal advertising executive, but only for a second.
62.author: Steven Wright

63.quote: I should have been a country-western singer. After all, I'm older than most western countries.
63.author: George Burns

64.quote: I sold my memoirs of my love life to Parker Brothers...they're going to make a game out of it.
64.author: Woody Allen

65.quote: I stayed up all night playing poker with tarot cards. I got a full house and four people died.
65.author: Steven Wright

66.quote: I think we're all Bozos on this bus.
66.author: Firesign Theatre

67.quote: I thought there was something fishy about the butler. Probably a Pisces, working for scale.
67.author: Firesign Theatre, The Further Adventures of Nick Danger

68.quote: I took a course in speed reading and was able to read War and Peace in twenty minutes. It's about Russia.
68.author: Woody Allen

69.quote: I used to work in a fire hydrant factory. You couldn't park anywhere near the place.
69.author: Steven Wright

70.quote: I was at this restaurant. The sign said Breakfast Anytime. So I ordered French Toast in the Rennaissance.
70.author: Steven Wright

71.quote: I was in Vegas last week. I was at the roulette table, having a lengthy argument about what I considered an Odd number.
71.author: Steven Wright

72.quote: I was the best I ever had.
72.author: Woody Allen

73.quote: I went into a general store, and they wouldn't sell me anything specific.
73.author: Steven Wright

74.quote: I went to the museum where they had all the heads and arms from the statues that are in all the other museums.
74.author: Steven Wright

75.quote: I worked in a health food store once. A guy came in and asked me, If I melt dry ice, can I take a bath without getting wet?
75.author: Steven Wright

76.quote: I'd horsewhip you if I had a horse.
76.author: Groucho Marx

77.quote: I'D LIKE TO BE BURIED INDIAN-STYLE, where they put you up on a high rack, above the ground. That way, you could get hit by meteorites and not even feel it.
77.author: Jack Handey, The New Mexican, 1988.

78.quote: I'd never join any club that would have the likes of me as a member.
78.author: Groucho Marx

79.quote: I'll be comfortable on the couch. Famous last words.
79.author: Lenny Bruce

80.quote: I'm going to Boston to see my doctor. He's a very sick man.
80.author: Fred Allen

81.quote: I'm going to give my psychoanalyst one more year, then I'm going to Lourdes.
81.author: Woody Allen

82.quote: I'm going to live forever, or die trying!
82.author: Spider Robinson

83.quote: I'm not afraid of death...I just don't want to be there when it happens.
83.author: Woody Allen

84.quote: I've had a perfectly wonderful evening. But this wasn't it.
84.author: Groucho Marx

85.quote: If God had wanted us to be concerned for the plight of the toads, he would have made them cute and furry.
85.author: Dave Barry

86.quote: If only Dionysus were alive! Where would he eat?
86.author: Woody Allen

87.quote: If only God would give me some clear sign! Like making a large deposit in my name at a Swiss bank.
87.author: Woody Allen, Without Feathers

88.quote: If you live to the age of a hundred you have it made because very few people die past the age of a hundred.
88.author: George Burns

89.quote: If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.
89.author: Woody Allen

90.quote: If you've done six impossible things before breakfast, why not round it off with dinner at Milliway's, the restaurant at the end of the universe?
90.author: Douglas Adams, The Restaurant at the End of the Universe

91.quote: In like a dimwit, out like a light.
91.author: Pogo

92.quote: Is it weird in here, or is it just me?
92.author: Steven Wright

93.quote: It is impossible to experience one's death objectively and still carry a tune.
93.author: Woody Allen

94.quote: It isn't necessary to have relatives in Kansas City in order to be unhappy.
94.author: Groucho Marx

95.quote: It looked like something resembling white marble, which was probably what it was: something resembling white marble.
95.author: Douglas Adams, The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy

96.quote: It's a small world, but I wouldn't want to have to paint it.
96.author: Steven Wright

97.quote: It's hard to get ivory in Africa, but in Alabama the Tuscaloosa.
97.author: Groucho Marx

98.quote: It's not that I'm afraid to die. I just don't want to be there when it happens.
98.author: Woody Allen

99.quote: Last night the power went out. Good thing my camera had a flash.... The neighbors thought it was lightning in my house, so they called the cops.
99.author: Steven Wright

100.quote: Last year we drove across the country... We switched on the driving... every half mile. We had one cassette tape to listen to on the entire trip. I don't remember what it was.
100.author: Steven Wright

101.quote: Life is divided into the horrible and the miserable.
101.author: Woody Allen, Annie Hall

102.quote: Life is wasted on the living.
102.author: The Restaurant at the End of the Universe.

103.quote: My brother sent me a postcard the other day with this big satellite photo of the entire earth on it. On the back it said: Wish you were here.
103.author: Steven Wright

104.quote: My friend has a baby. I'm writing down all the noises he makes so later I can ask him what he meant.
104.author: Steven Wright

105.quote: Nietzsche says that we will live the same life, over and over again. God...I'll have to sit through the Ice Capades again.
105.author: Woody Allen, Hannah and Her Sisters

106.quote: Nirvana? That's the place where the powers that be and their friends hang out.
106.author: Zonker Harris

108.quote: Now is the time for all good men to come to.
108.author: Walt Kelly

109.quote: One doesn't have a sense of humor. It has you.
109.author: Larry Gelbart

110.quote: Outside of a dog, a book is a man's best friend. Inside a dog it's too dark to read.
110.author: Groucho Marx

111.quote: Right now I'm having amnesia and deja vu at the same time.
111.author: Steven Wright

112.quote: Rincewind formed a mental picture of some strange entity living in a castle made of teeth. It was the kind of mental picture you tried to forget. Unsuccessfully.
112.author: Terry Pratchett, The Light Fantastic

113.quote: Romeo wasn't bilked in a day.
113.author: Walt Kelly, Ten Ever-Lovin' Blue-Eyed Years With Pogo

114.quote: Sharks are as tough as those football fans who take their shirts off during games in Chicago in January, only more intelligent.
114.author: Dave Barry

116.quote: SOMETIMES THE BEAUTY OF THE WORLD is so overwhelming, I just want to throw back my head and gargle. Just gargle and gargle and I don't care who hears me because I am beautiful.
116.author: Jack Handey, The New Mexican, 1988.

117.quote: Thank goodness modern convenience is a thing of the remote future.
117.author: Pogo, by Walt Kelly

118.quote: The best cure for insomnia is to get a lot of sleep.
118.author: W. C. Fields

119.quote: The best way to make a fire with two sticks is to make sure one of them is a match.
119.author: Will Rogers

120.quote: The buffalo isn't as dangerous as everyone makes him out to be. Statistics prove that in the United States more Americans are killed in automobile accidents than are killed by buffalo.
120.author: Art Buchwald

121.quote: The grand leap of the whale up the Fall of Niagara is esteemed, by all who have seen it, as one of the finest spectacles in nature.
121.author: Benjamin Franklin.

122.quote: The other day I... uh, no, that wasn't me.
122.author: Steven Wright

123.quote: There comes a time in the affairs of a man when he has to take the bull by the tail and face the situation.
123.author: W. C. Fields

124.quote: There's no easy quick way out, we're gonna have to live through our whole lives, win, lose, or draw.
124.author: Walt Kelly

125.quote: There's so much plastic in this culture that vinyl leopard skin is becoming an endangered synthetic.
125.author: Lily Tomlin

126.quote: Things will get better despite our efforts to improve them.
126.author: Will Rogers

127.quote: This land is full of trousers! this land is full of mausers! And pussycats to eat them when the sun goes down!
127.author: Firesign Theater

128.quote: Time is an illusion, lunchtime doubly so.
128.author: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

129.quote: TOO BAD YOU CAN'T BUY a voodoo globe so that you could make the earth spin real fast and freak everybody out.
129.author: Jack Handey, The New Mexican, 1988.

130.quote: Twenty Percent of Zero is Better than Nothing.
130.author: Walt Kelly

131.quote: We have met the enemy, and he is us.
131.author: Walt Kelly

132.quote: We is confronted with insurmountable opportunities.
132.author: Walt Kelly, Pogo

133.quote: What if everything is an illusion and nothing exists? In that case, I definitely overpaid for my carpet.
133.author: Woody Allen, Without Feathers

134.quote: What if nothing exists and we're all in somebody's dream? Or what's worse, what if only that fat guy in the third row exists?
134.author: Woody Allen, Without Feathers

135.quote: What is comedy? Comedy is the art of making people laugh without making them puke.
135.author: Steve Martin

137.quote: When I was crossing the border into Canada, they asked if I had any firearms with me. I said, Well, what do you need?
137.author: Steven Wright

138.quote: When I was little, I went into a pet shop and they asked how big I'd get.
138.author: Rodney Dangerfield

139.quote: When I woke up this morning, my girlfriend asked if I had slept well. I said, No, I made a few mistakes.
139.author: Steven Wright

140.quote: Where humor is concerned there are no standards...no one can say what is good or bad, although you can be sure that everyone will.
140.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

141.quote: Why is the alphabet in that order? Is it because of that song?
141.author: Steven Wright

142.quote: You can't have everything. Where would you put it?
142.author: Steven Wright

143.quote: You may already be a loser.
143.author: Form letter received by Rodney Dangerfield.

144.quote: You'd better beat it. You can leave in a taxi. If you can't get a taxi, you can leave in a huff. If that's too soon, you can leave in a minute and a huff.
144.author: Groucho Marx

145.quote: A career is great, but you can't run your fingers through its hair.
145.author: Unknown

146.quote: A kiss is a course of procedure, cunningly devised, for the mutual stoppage of speech at a moment when words are superfluous.
146.author: Unknown

147.quote: A woman was in love with fourteen soldiers. It was clearly platoonic.
147.author: Unknown

148.quote: Absence diminishes mediocre passions and increases great ones, as the wind blows out candles and fans fires.
148.author: La Rochefoucauld

149.quote: Absence in love is like water upon fire; a little quickens, but much extinguishes it.
149.author: Hannah More

150.quote: All the passions make us commit faults; love makes us commit the most ridiculous ones.
150.author: La Rochefoucauld

151.quote: Always there remain portions of our heart into which no one is able to enter, invite them as we may. Bondage maybe, discipline never!
151.author: T.K.

152.quote: Distrust all those who love you extremely upon a very slight acquaintance and without any visible reason.
152.author: Lord Chesterfield

153.quote: Don't despair; your ideal lover is waiting for you around the corner.
153.author: Unknown

154.quote: Falling in love is a lot like dying. You never get to do it enough to become good at it. Give me chastity and continence, but not just now.
154.author: St. Augustine

155.quote: God is love, but get it in writing.
155.author: Gypsy Rose Lee

156.quote: He did decide, though, that with more time and a great deal of mental effort, he could probably turn the activity into an acceptable perversion.
156.author: Mick Farren, When Gravity Fails

157.quote: He who is in love with himself has at least this advantage...he won't encounter many rivals.
157.author: Georg Lichtenberg, Aphorisms

158.quote: Hearts will never be practical until they can be made unbreakable.
158.author: The Wizard of Oz

159.quote: His heart was yours from the first moment that you met. How much does she love you? Less than you'll ever know. I am two fools, I know, for loving, and for saying so.
159.author: John Donne

160.quote: I can mend the break of day, heal a broken heart, and provide temporary relief to nymphomaniacs.
160.author: Larry Lee

161.quote: I don't want people to love me. It makes for obligations.
161.author: Jean Anouilh

162.quote: I love you more than anything in this world. I don't expect that will last.
162.author: Elvis Costello

163.quote: I love you, not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you.
163.author: Roy Croft

164.quote: I loved her with a love thirsty and desperate. I felt that we two might commit some act so atrocious that the world, seeing us, would find it irresistible.
164.author: Gene Wolfe, The Shadow of the Torturer

165.quote: I never loved another person the way I loved myself.
165.author: Mae West

166.quote: I think a relationship is like a shark. It has to constantly move forward or it dies. Well, what we have on our hands here is a dead shark.
166.author: Woody Allen

167.quote: I used to be Snow White, but I drifted.
167.author: Mae West

168.quote: I used to think romantic love was a neurosis shared by two, a supreme foolishness. I no longer thought that. There's nothing foolish in loving anyone. Thinking you'll be loved in return is what's foolish.
168.author: Rita Mae Brown

169.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but I did my own thing and now I've got to undo it. I'd love to go out with you, but I have to floss my cat.
169.author: Unknown

170.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but I have to stay home and see if I snore.
170.author: Unknown

171.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but I never go out on days that end in `Y.'
171.author: Unknown

172.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but I want to spend more time with my blender.
172.author: Unknown

173.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but I'm attending the opening of my garage door.
173.author: Unknown

174.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but I'm converting my calendar watch from Julian to Gregorian.
174.author: Unknown

175.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but I'm doing door-to-door collecting for static cling.
175.author: Unknown

176.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but I'm having all my plants neutered.
176.author: Unknown

177.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but I'm staying home to work on my cottage cheese sculpture.
177.author: Unknown

178.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but I'm taking punk totem pole carving.
178.author: Unknown

179.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but I've been scheduled for a karma transplant.
179.author: Unknown

180.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but it's my parakeet's bowling night.
180.author: Unknown

181.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but my favorite commercial is on TV.
181.author: Unknown

182.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but the last time I went out, I never came back.
182.author: Unknown

183.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but the man on television told me to stay tuned.
183.author: Unknown

184.quote: I'd love to go out with you, but there are important world issues that need worrying about.
184.author: Unknown

185.quote: I'd love to kiss you, but I just washed my hair.
185.author: Bette Davis, Cabin in the Cotton

186.quote: If love is the answer, could you rephrase the question?
186.author: Lily Tomlin

187.quote: If Love Were Oil, I'd Be About A Quart Low
187.author: Book title by Lewis Grizzard

188.quote: If only you knew she loved you, you could face the uncertainty of whether you love her.
188.author: Unknown

189.quote: If you can't be good, be careful. If you can't be careful, give me a call.
189.author: Unknown

190.quote: If you love someone, set them free. If they don't come back, then call them up when you're drunk.
190.author: Unknown

191.quote: In a great romance, each person basically plays a part that the other really likes.
191.author: Elizabeth Ashley

192.quote: In an age when the fashion is to be in love with yourself, confessing to be in love with somebody else is an admission of unfaithfulness to one's beloved.
192.author: Russell Baker

193.quote: In love, she who gives her portrait promises the original.
193.author: Bruton

194.quote: In real love you want the other person's good. In romantic love you want the other person.
194.author: Margaret Anderson

195.quote: It is far better to be deceived than to be undeceived by those we love.
195.author: Unknown

196.quote: Just how difficult it is to write biography can be reckoned by anybody who sits down and considers just how many people know the real truth about his or her love affairs.
196.author: Rebecca West

197.quote: Let's just be friends and make no special effort to ever see each other again.
197.author: Unknown

198.quote: Let's not complicate our relationship by trying to communicate with each other.
198.author: Unknown

199.quote: Lonely is a man without love.
199.author: Englebert Humperdinck

200.quote: Love...the last of the serious diseases of childhood.
200.author: Unknown

201.quote: Love and scandal are the best sweeteners of tea.
201.author: Unknown

202.quote: Love at first sight is one of the greatest labor-saving devices the world has ever seen.
202.author: Unknown

203.quote: Love cannot be much younger than the lust for murder.
203.author: Sigmund Freud

204.quote: Love conquers all things; let us too surrender to love.
204.author: Publius Vergilius Maro (Virgil)

205.quote: Love is a grave mental disease.
205.author: Plato

206.quote: Love is a snowmobile racing across the tundra, which suddenly flips over, pinning you underneath. At night the ice weasels come.
206.author: Matt Groening, Love is Hell

207.quote: Love is always open arms. With arms open you allow love to come and go as it wills, freely, for it will do so anyway. If you close your arms about love you'll find you are left only holding yourself.
207.author: Unknown

209.quote: Love is dope, not chicken soup. I mean, love is something to be passed around freely, not spooned down someone's throat for their own good by a Jewish mother who cooked it all by herself.
209.author: Unknown

210.quote: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.
210.author: Bruce Lee

211.quote: Love is like the measles; we all have to go through it.
211.author: Jerome K. Jerome

213.quote: Love is not enough, but it sure helps.
213.author: Unknown

215.quote: Love is staying up all night with a sick child, or a healthy adult.
215.author: Unknown

216.quote: Love is the only game that is not called on account of darkness.
216.author: M. Hirschfield

217.quote: Love is the process of my leading you gently back to yourself.
217.author: Saint Exupery

218.quote: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.
218.author: H. L. Mencken

219.quote: Love IS what it's cracked up to be.
219.author: Unknown

220.quote: Love is what you've been through with somebody.
220.author: James Thurber

221.quote: Love isn't only blind, it's also deaf, dumb, and stupid.
221.author: Unknown

222.quote: Love means having to say you're sorry every five minutes.
222.author: Unknown

223.quote: Love means never having to say you're sorry.
223.author: Eric Segal, Love Story

224.quote: That's the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard.
224.author: Ryan O'Neill, What's Up Doc?

225.quote: Love tells us many things that are not so.
225.author: Krainian Proverb

226.quote: Maybe we should think of this as one perfect week... where we found each other, and loved each other... and then let each other go before anyone had to seek professional help.
226.author: Unknown

227.quote: Most people don't need a great deal of love nearly so much as they need a steady supply.
227.author: Unknown

228.quote: My cup hath runneth'd over with love.
228.author: Unknown

229.quote: Nature abhors a virgin...a frozen asset.
229.author: Clare Booth Luce

230.quote: Of all forms of caution, caution in love is the most fatal.
230.author: Unknown

231.quote: Of course it's possible to love a human being if you don't know them too well.
231.author: Charles Bukowski

232.quote: Oh, love is real enough, you will find it some day, but it has one arch-enemy...and that is life.
232.author: Jean Anouilh, Ardele

233.quote: On a tous un peu peur de l'amour, mais on a surtout peur de souffrir ou de faire souffrir. [One is always a little afraid of love, but above all, one is afraid of pain or causing pain.]
233.author: Unknown

234.quote: One expresses well the love he does not feel.
234.author: J. A. Karr

235.quote: People think love is an emotion. Love is good sense.
235.author: Ken Kesey

236.quote: Really?? What a coincidence, I'm shallow too!!
236.author: Unknown

237.quote: Sometime when you least expect it, Love will tap you on the shoulder... and ask you to move out of the way because it still isn't your turn.
237.author: N. V. Plyter

238.quote: Sometimes love ain't nothing but a misunderstanding between two fools.
238.author: Unknown

239.quote: Sorry never means having your say to love.
239.author: Unknown

240.quote: Support wildlife...vote for an orgy. The giraffe you thought you offended last week is willing to be nuzzled today.
240.author: Unknown

241.quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows nothing of.
241.author: Blaise Pascal

242.quote: The heart is wiser than the intellect.
242.author: Unknown

243.quote: The little pieces of my life I give to you, with love, to make a quilt to keep away the cold.
243.author: Unknown

244.quote: The magic of our first love is our ignorance that it can ever end.
244.author: Benjamin Disraeli

245.quote: The myth of romantic love holds that once you've fallen in love with the perfect partner, you're home free. Unfortunately, falling out of love seems to be just as involuntary as falling into it.
245.author: Unknown

246.quote: The only difference in the game of love over the last few thousand years is that they've changed trumps from clubs to diamonds.
246.author: The Indianapolis Star

247.quote: The onset and the waning of love make themselves felt in the uneasiness experienced at being alone together.
247.author: Jean de la Bruyere

248.quote: The perfect lover is one who turns into a pizza at 4:00 A.M.
248.author: Charles Pierce

249.quote: The person you rejected yesterday could make you happy, if you say yes.
249.author: Unknown

250.quote: The seven year itch comes from fooling around during the fourth, fifth, and sixth years.
250.author: Unknown

251.quote: The sweeter the apple, the blacker the core...Scratch a lover and find a foe!
251.author: Dorothy Parker, Ballad of a Great Weariness

252.quote: The way to love anything is to realize that it might be lost.
252.author: Unknown

253.quote: There are some micro-organisms that exhibit characteristics of both plants and animals. When exposed to light they undergo photosynthesis; and when the lights go out, they turn into animals. But then again, don't we all?
253.author: Unknown

254.quote: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casts out fear.
254.author: 1 John 4:18

255.quote: There is only one way to be happy by means of the heart...to have none.
255.author: Paul Bourget

256.quote: There's so much to say but your eyes keep interrupting me.
256.author: Unknown

257.quote: Timing must be perfect now. Two-timing must be better than perfect.
257.author: Unknown

258.quote: To be loved is very demoralizing.
258.author: Katharine Hepburn

259.quote: To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already three parts dead.
259.author: Bertrand Russell

260.quote: Total strangers need love, too; and I'm stranger than most.
260.author: Unknown

261.quote: True happiness will be found only in true love.
261.author: Unknown

262.quote: Under deadline pressure for the next week. If you want something, it can wait. Unless it's blind screaming paroxysmally hedonistic...
262.author: Unknown

263.quote: We don't believe in rheumatism and true love until after the first attack.
263.author: Marie Ebner von Eschenbach

264.quote: What is irritating about love is that it is a crime that requires an accomplice.
264.author: Charles Baudelaire

265.quote: When your life is a leaf that the seasons tear off and condemn They will bind you with love that is graceful and green as a stem.
265.author: Leonard Cohen, Sisters of Mercy

266.quote: Why must you tell me all your secrets when it's hard enough to love you knowing nothing?
266.author: Lloyd Cole and the Commotions

267.quote: Without love intelligence is dangerous; without intelligence love is not enough.
267.author: Ashley Montagu

268.quote: Wouldn't this be a great world if being insecure and desperate were a turn-on?
268.author: Broadcast News

269.quote: Yeah, there are more important things in life than money, but they won't go out with you if you don't have any.
269.author: Unknown

270.quote: You shouldn't have to pay for your love with your bones and your flesh.
270.author: Pat Benatar, Hell is for Children

271.quote: A clash of doctrine is not a disaster...it is an opportunity.
271.author: Unknown

272.quote: A dream will always triumph over reality, once it is given the chance.
272.author: Stanislaw Lem

273.quote: A fake fortuneteller can be tolerated. But an authentic soothsayer should be shot on sight. Cassandra did not get half the kicking around she deserved.
273.author: R. A. Heinlein

274.quote: A lifetime isn't nearly long enough to figure out what it's all about.
274.author: Unknown

275.quote: A lot of people I know believe in positive thinking, and so do I. I believe everything positively stinks.
275.author: Lew Col

276.quote: A priest advised Voltaire on his death bed to renounce the devil. Replied Voltaire, This is no time to make new enemies.
276.author: Unknown

277.quote: A sad spectacle. If they be inhabited, what a scope for misery and folly. If they be not inhabited, what a waste of space.
277.author: Thomas Carlyle, looking at the stars

278.quote: A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it.
278.author: Oscar Wilde, The Portrait of Mr. W. H.

279.quote: Ah, but a man's grasp should exceed his reach, Or what's a heaven for ?
279.author: Robert Browning, Andrea del Sarto

280.quote: All hope abandon, ye who enter here!
280.author: Dante Alighieri

281.quote: All men know the utility of useful things; but they do not know the utility of futility.
281.author: Chuang-tzu

282.quote: All of the true things I am about to tell you are shameless lies.
282.author: The Book of Bokonon / Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

283.quote: All of us should treasure his Oriental wisdom and his preaching of a Zen-like detachment, as exemplified by his constant reminder to clerks, tellers, or others who grew excited by his presence in their banks: Just lie down on the floor and keep calm.
283.author: Robert Wilson, John Dillinger Died for You

284.quote: An idea is an eye given by God for the seeing of God. Some of these eyes we cannot bear to look out of, we blind them as quickly as possible.
284.author: Russell Hoban, Pilgermann

285.quote: An idea is not responsible for the people who believe in it.
285.author: Unknown

286.quote: And ever has it been known that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.
286.author: Kahlil Gibran

287.quote: Arrakis teaches the attitude of the knife - chopping off what's incomplete and saying: Now it's complete because it's ended here.
287.author: Muad'dib, Dune

288.quote: As failures go, attempting to recall the past is like trying to grasp the meaning of existence. Both make one feel like a baby clutching at a basketball: one's palms keep sliding off.
288.author: Joseph Brodsky

289.quote: At ebb tide I wrote a line upon the sand, and gave it all my heart and all my soul. At flood tide I returned to read what I had inscribed and found my ignorance upon the shore.
289.author: Kahlil Gibran

290.quote: At the end of your life there'll be a good rest, and no further activities are scheduled.
290.author: Unknown

291.quote: At the foot of the mountain, thunder: The image of Providing Nourishment. Thus the superior man is careful of his words And temperate in eating and drinking.
291.author: Unknown

292.quote: Beauty is one of the rare things which does not lead to doubt of God.
292.author: Jean Anouilh

293.quote: Before you ask more questions, think about whether you really want to know the answers.
293.author: Gene Wolfe, The Claw of the Conciliator

294.quote: Brahma said: Well, after hearing ten thousand explanations, a fool is no wiser. But an intelligent man needs only two thousand five hundred.
294.author: The Mahabharata

295.quote: By protracting life, we do not deduct one jot from the duration of death.
295.author: Titus Lucretius Carus

296.quote: Catharsis is something I associate with pornography and crossword puzzles.
296.author: Howard Chaykin

297.quote: Certainly the game is rigged. Don't let that stop you; if you don't bet, you can't win.
297.author: Robert Heinlein, Time Enough For Love

298.quote: Chance is perhaps the work of God when He did not want to sign.
298.author: Anatole France

299.quote: Circumstances rule men; men do not rule circumstances.
299.author: Herodotus

301.quote: Death is a spirit leaving a body, sort of like a shell leaving the nut behind.
301.author: Erma Bombeck

302.quote: Death is God's way of telling you not to be such a wise guy.
302.author: Unknown

303.quote: Death is life's way of telling you you've been fired.
303.author: R. Geis

304.quote: Death is Nature's way of recycling human beings.
304.author: Unknown

305.quote: Death is nature's way of saying `Howdy'.
305.author: Unknown

306.quote: Death is nature's way of telling you to slow down.
306.author: Unknown

307.quote: Death is only a state of mind. Only it doesn't leave you much time to think about anything else.
307.author: Unknown

308.quote: Depart not from the path which fate has assigned you.
308.author: Unknown

309.quote: Depend on the rabbit's foot if you will, but remember, it didn't help the rabbit.
309.author: R. E. Shay

310.quote: Destiny is a good thing to accept when it's going your way. When it isn't, don't call it destiny; call it injustice, treachery, or simple bad luck.
310.author: Joseph Heller, God Knows

311.quote: Disease can be cured; fate is incurable.
311.author: Chinese proverb

312.quote: Ditat Deus. [God enriches] Do not believe in miracles...rely on them.
312.author: Unknown

313.quote: Do not seek death; death will find you. But seek the road which makes death a fulfillment.
313.author: Dag Hammarskjold

314.quote: Do not take life too seriously; you will never get out of it alive.
314.author: Unknown

315.quote: Do what you can to prolong your life, in the hope that someday you'll learn what it's for.
315.author: Unknown

316.quote: Do your part to help preserve life on Earth...by trying to preserve your own.
316.author: Unknown

317.quote: Don't abandon hope. Your Captain Midnight decoder ring arrives tomorrow.
317.author: Unknown

318.quote: Don't abandon hope: your Tom Mix decoder ring arrives tomorrow.
318.author: Unknown

319.quote: Don't go to bed with no price on your head.
319.author: Baretta

320.quote: Don't have good ideas if you aren't willing to be responsible for them.
320.author: Unknown

321.quote: Don't kid yourself. Little is relevant, and nothing lasts forever.
321.author: Unknown

322.quote: Don't let people drive you crazy when you know it's in walking distance.
322.author: Unknown

323.quote: Don't make a big deal out of everything; just deal with everything.
323.author: Unknown

324.quote: Don't stop to stomp ants when the elephants are stampeding.
324.author: Unknown

325.quote: Don't take life seriously, you'll never get out alive.
325.author: Unknown

326.quote: Doubt isn't the opposite of faith; it is an element of faith.
326.author: Paul Tillich, German theologian.

328.quote: Due to circumstances beyond your control, you are master of your fate and captain of your soul.
328.author: Unknown

329.quote: During the voyage of life, remember to keep an eye out for a fair wind; batten down during a storm; hail all passing ships; and fly your colors proudly.
329.author: Unknown

330.quote: Dying is a very dull, dreary affair. My advice to you is to have nothing whatever to do with it.
330.author: W. Somerset Maugham, his last words

331.quote: Dying is one of the few things that can be done as easily lying down.
331.author: Woody Allen

332.quote: Each man is his own prisoner, in solitary confinement for life.
332.author: Unknown

333.quote: Each of us bears his own Hell.
333.author: Publius Vergilius Maro (Virgil)

334.quote: Either I'm dead or my watch has stopped.
334.author: Groucho Marx's last words

335.quote: Even the best of friends cannot attend each other's funeral.
335.author: Kehlog Albran, The Profit

336.quote: Every person, all the events in your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
336.author: Messiah's Handbook : Reminders for the Advanced Soul

337.quote: Everything ends badly. Otherwise it wouldn't end.
337.author: Unknown

338.quote: Everything in this book may be wrong.
338.author: Messiah's Handbook : Reminders for the Advanced Soul

339.quote: Everything is possible. Pass the word.
339.author: Rita Mae Brown, Six of One

340.quote: Execute every act of thy life as though it were thy last.
340.author: Marcus Aurelius

341.quote: Expansion means complexity; and complexity decay.
341.author: Unknown

342.quote: Facts are the enemy of truth.
342.author: Don Quixote

343.quote: Fain would I climb, yet fear I to fall.
343.author: Sir Walter Raleigh

344.quote: Faith goes out through the window when beauty comes in at the door.
344.author: Unknown

345.quote: Faith is under the left nipple.
345.author: Martin Luther

346.quote: Fill what's empty, empty what's full, scratch where it itches.
346.author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

347.quote: For fast-acting relief, try slowing down.
347.author: Unknown

348.quote: For good, return good. For evil, return justice.
348.author: Unknown

349.quote: For if there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life and in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
349.author: Albert Camus

350.quote: For your penance, say five Hail Marys and one loud BLAH!
350.author: Unknown

351.quote: Force has no place where there is need of skill.
351.author: Herodotus

352.quote: FORTUNE'S RULES TO LIVE BY: #2 Never goose a wolverine.
352.author: Unknown

353.quote: FORTUNE'S RULES TO LIVE BY: #23 Don't cut off a police car when making an illegal U-turn.
353.author: Unknown

354.quote: From listening comes wisdom and from speaking repentance.
354.author: Unknown

355.quote: From the cradle to the coffin underwear comes first.
355.author: Bertolt Brecht

356.quote: Generally speaking, the Way of the warrior is resolute acceptance of death.
356.author: Miyamoto Musashi, 1645

358.quote: Getting there is only half as far as getting there and back.
358.author: Unknown

359.quote: Given a choice between grief and nothing, I'd choose grief.
359.author: William Faulkner

360.quote: God grant us the serenity to accept the things we cannot change, courage to change the things we can, and wisdom to know the difference.
360.author: Unknown

361.quote: God instructs the heart, not by ideas, but by pains and contradictions.
361.author: De Caussade

362.quote: God is the tangential point between zero and infinity.
362.author: Alfred Jarry

363.quote: God made everything out of nothing, but the nothingness shows through.
363.author: Paul Valery

364.quote: Good-bye. I am leaving because I am bored.
364.author: George Saunders' dying words

366.quote: Got a dictionary? I want to know the meaning of life.
366.author: Unknown

367.quote: Great acts are made up of small deeds.
367.author: Lao Tsu

368.quote: Happiness is having a scratch for every itch.
368.author: Ogden Nash

369.quote: Happiness is just an illusion, filled with sadness and confusion.
369.author: Unknown

370.quote: Happiness isn't having what you want, it's wanting what you have.
370.author: Unknown

371.quote: Happiness isn't something you experience; it's something you remember.
371.author: Oscar Levant

372.quote: Having the fewest wants, I am nearest to the gods.
372.author: Socrates

373.quote: He has shown you, o man, what is good. And what does the Lord ask of you, but to do justice, and to love kindness, and to walk humbly before your God?
373.author: Unknown

374.quote: He is truly wise who gains wisdom from another's mishap.
374.author: Unknown

375.quote: He knows not how to know who knows not also how to unknow.
375.author: Sir Richard Burton

376.quote: He that composes himself is wiser than he that composes a book.
376.author: B. Franklin

377.quote: He who despairs over an event is a coward, but he who holds hopes for the human condition is a fool.
377.author: Albert Camus

378.quote: He who knows others is wise. He who knows himself is enlightened.
378.author: Lao Tsu

379.quote: He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.
379.author: Lao Tsu

380.quote: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
380.author: Lao Tsu

381.quote: Here is a test to find whether your mission on earth is finished: if you're alive, it isn't.
381.author: Unknown

382.quote: How can you prove whether at this moment we are sleeping, and all our thoughts are a dream; or whether we are awake, and talking to one another in the waking state?
382.author: Plato

383.quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow, for I have seen yesterday and I love today.
383.author: William Allen White

384.quote: I didn't believe in reincarnation in any of my other lives. I don't see why I should have to believe in it in this one.
384.author: Strange de Jim

385.quote: I do not know whether I was then a man dreaming I was a butterfly, or whether I am now a butterfly dreaming I am a man.
385.author: Chuang-tzu

386.quote: I do not seek the ignorant; the ignorant seek me...I will instruct them. I ask nothing but sincerity. If they come out of habit, they become tiresome.
386.author: I Ching

387.quote: I gained nothing at all from Supreme Enlightenment, and for that very reason it is called Supreme Enlightenment.
387.author: Gotama Buddha

389.quote: I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches.
389.author: A. R. Longworth

390.quote: I have often regretted my speech, never my silence.
390.author: Publilius Syrus

391.quote: I have seen the future and it is just like the present, only longer.
391.author: Kehlog Albran, The Profit

392.quote: I hope you're not pretending to be evil while secretly being good. That would be dishonest.
392.author: Unknown

393.quote: I just forgot my whole philosophy of life!!!
393.author: Unknown

394.quote: I know not how I came into this, shall I call it a dying life or a living death?
394.author: St. Augustine

395.quote: If a guru falls in the forest with no one to hear him, was he really a guru at all?
395.author: Strange de Jim, The Metasexuals

396.quote: If a man has a strong faith he can indulge in the luxury of skepticism.
396.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

397.quote: If a man loses his reverence for any part of life, he will lose his reverence for all of life.
397.author: Albert Schweitzer

398.quote: If little green men land in your back yard, hide any little green women you've got in the house.
398.author: Mike Harding, The Armchair Anarchist's Almanac

399.quote: If something has not yet gone wrong then it would ultimately have been beneficial for it to go wrong.
399.author: Unknown

400.quote: If the master dies and the disciple grieves, the lives of both have been wasted.
400.author: Unknown

401.quote: If the path be beautiful, let us not ask where it leads.
401.author: Anatole France

402.quote: If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life and in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
402.author: Albert Camus

403.quote: If we do not change our direction we are likely to end up where we are headed.
403.author: Unknown

404.quote: If we don't survive, we don't do anything else.
404.author: John Sinclair

405.quote: If you are not for yourself, who will be for you? If you are for yourself, then what are you? If not now, when?
405.author: Unknown

406.quote: If you can survive death, you can probably survive anything.
406.author: Unknown

407.quote: If you find a solution and become attached to it, the solution may become your next problem.
407.author: Unknown

408.quote: If you fool around with something long enough, it will eventually break.
408.author: Unknown

409.quote: If you have to hate, hate gently.
409.author: Unknown

410.quote: If you have to think twice about it, you're wrong.
410.author: Unknown

411.quote: If you keep anything long enough, you can throw it away.
411.author: Unknown

412.quote: If you live long enough, you'll see that every victory turns into a defeat.
412.author: Simone de Beauvoir

413.quote: If you only have a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
413.author: Maslow

414.quote: If you put it off long enough, it might go away.
414.author: Unknown

415.quote: If you refuse to accept anything but the best you very often get it.
415.author: Unknown

416.quote: If you wait long enough, it will go away... after having done its damage. If it was bad, it will be back.
416.author: Unknown

417.quote: If you want divine justice, die.
417.author: Nick Seldon

418.quote: If your aim in life is nothing, you can't miss.
418.author: Unknown

419.quote: If your happiness depends on what somebody else does, I guess you do have a problem.
419.author: Richard Bach, Illusions

420.quote: Illusion is the first of all pleasures.
420.author: Voltaire

422.quote: In order to discover who you are, first learn who everybody else is; you're what's left.
422.author: Unknown

423.quote: In order to live free and happily, you must sacrifice boredom. It is not always an easy sacrifice.
423.author: Unknown

424.quote: In spite of everything, I still believe that people are good at heart.
424.author: Anne Frank

425.quote: In the long run we are all dead.
425.author: John Maynard Keynes

426.quote: In the next world, you're on your own.
426.author: Unknown

427.quote: Indeed, the first noble truth of Buddhism, usually translated as `all life is suffering,' is more accurately rendered `life is filled with a sense of pervasive unsatisfactoriness.'
427.author: M. D. Epstein

428.quote: Instead of loving your enemies, treat your friends a little better.
428.author: Edgar W. Howe

429.quote: Intellect annuls Fate. So far as a man thinks, he is free.
429.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

430.quote: It does not do to leave a live dragon out of your calculations.
430.author: Unknown

431.quote: It is easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle if it is lightly greased.
431.author: Kehlog Albran, The Profit

432.quote: It is Fortune, not Wisdom, that rules man's life.
432.author: Unknown

433.quote: It is not doing the thing we like to do, but liking the thing we have to do, that makes life blessed.
433.author: Goethe

434.quote: It is only by risking our persons from one hour to another that we live at all. And often enough our faith beforehand in an uncertified result is the only thing that makes the result come true.
434.author: William James

435.quote: It is only with the heart one can see clearly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
435.author: The Fox, 'The Little Prince

436.quote: It is said that the lonely eagle flies to the mountain peaks while the lowly ant crawls the ground, but cannot the soul of the ant soar as high as the eagle?
436.author: Unknown

437.quote: It is so stupid of modern civilisation to have given up believing in the devil when he is the only explanation of it.
437.author: Ronald Knox, Let Dons Delight

438.quote: It is through symbols that man consciously or unconsciously lives, works and has his being.
438.author: Thomas Carlyle

439.quote: It will be advantageous to cross the great stream ... the Dragon is on the wing in the Sky ... the Great Man rouses himself to his Work.
439.author: Unknown

440.quote: It's easier to take it apart than to put it back together.
440.author: Washlesky

441.quote: It's hard to drive at the limit, but it's harder to know where the limits are.
441.author: Stirling Moss

442.quote: It's not reality that's important, but how you perceive things.
442.author: Unknown

443.quote: It's today! said Piglet. My favorite day, said Pooh.
443.author: Unknown

444.quote: It's very inconvenient to be mortal...you never know when everything may suddenly stop happening.
444.author: Unknown

445.quote: Just remember, wherever you go, there you are.
445.author: Buckaroo Bonzai

446.quote: Kindness is the beginning of cruelty.
446.author: Muad'dib [Frank Herbert, Dune]

447.quote: Let us not look back in anger or forward in fear, but around us in awareness.
447.author: James Thurber

448.quote: Life can be so tragic...you're here today and here tomorrow.
448.author: Unknown

449.quote: Life exists for no known purpose.
449.author: Unknown

450.quote: Life is a grand adventure...or it is nothing.
450.author: Helen Keller

451.quote: Life is knowing how far to go without crossing the line.
451.author: Unknown~

452.quote: Life is like a 10 speed bicycle. Most of us have gears we never use.
452.author: C. Schultz

453.quote: Life is like a sewer. What you get out of it depends on what you put into it.
453.author: Tom Lehrer

454.quote: Life is the childhood of our immortality.
454.author: Goethe

455.quote: Life is the living you do, Death is the living you don't do.
455.author: Joseph Pintauro

456.quote: Life is the urge to ecstasy.
456.author: Unknown

457.quote: Life may have no meaning, or, even worse, it may have a meaning of which you disapprove.
457.author: Unknown

458.quote: Life only demands from you the strength you possess. Only one feat is possible...not to have run away.
458.author: Dag Hammarskjold

459.quote: Life sucks, but death doesn't put out at all.
459.author: Thomas J. Kopp

460.quote: Live never to be ashamed if anything you do or say is published around the world...even if what is published is not true.
460.author: Messiah's Handbook : Reminders for the Advanced Soul

461.quote: Living in the complex world of the future is somewhat like having bees live in your head. But, there they are.
461.author: Unknown

462.quote: Loneliness is a terrible price to pay for independence.
462.author: Unknown

463.quote: Man's reach must exceed his grasp, for why else the heavens?
463.author: Unknown

464.quote: Mohandas K. Gandhi often changed his mind publicly. An aide once asked him how he could so freely contradict this week what he had said just last week. The great man replied that it was because this week he knew better.
464.author: Unknown

466.quote: Murphy's Law is recursive. Washing your car to make it rain doesn't work.
466.author: Unknown

467.quote: Music in the soul can be heard by the universe.
467.author: Lao Tsu

468.quote: My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind.
468.author: Albert Einstein

469.quote: My theology, briefly, is that the universe was dictated but not signed.
469.author: Christopher Morley

470.quote: Nasrudin called at a large house to collect for charity. The servant said My master is out. Nasrudin replied, Tell your master that next time he goes out, he should not leave his face at the window. Someone might steal it.
470.author: Unknown

471.quote: Ninety percent of everything is crap.
471.author: Theodore Sturgeon

472.quote: Ninety percent of the time things turn out worse than you thought they would. The other ten percent of the time you had no right to expect that much.
472.author: Augustine

473.quote: No matter where I go, the place is always called here.
473.author: Unknown

474.quote: No use getting too involved in life...you're only here for a limited time.
474.author: Unknown

475.quote: Nobody ever ruined their eyesight by looking at the bright side of something.
475.author: Unknown

476.quote: Nonsense and beauty have close connections.
476.author: E. M. Forster

477.quote: Normal times may possibly be over forever.
477.author: Unknown

478.quote: Not every question deserves an answer.
478.author: Unknown

479.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood.
479.author: Unknown

480.quote: Nothing is as simple as it seems at first Or as hopeless as it seems in the middle Or as finished as it seems in the end.
480.author: Unknown

481.quote: Nothing is but what is not.
481.author: Unknown

482.quote: Nothing is ever a total loss; it can always serve as a bad example.
482.author: Unknown

483.quote: Nothing is so firmly believed as that which we least know.
483.author: Michel de Montaigne

484.quote: Nothing matters very much, and few things matter at all.
484.author: Arthur Balfour

485.quote: Of all men's miseries, the bitterest is this: to know so much and have control over nothing.
485.author: Herodotus

486.quote: Once the toothpaste is out of the tube, it's hard to get it back in.
486.author: H. R. Haldeman

487.quote: Once you've tried to change the world you find it's a whole bunch easier to change your mind.
487.author: Unknown

488.quote: One learns to itch where one can scratch.
488.author: Ernest Bramah

489.quote: One meets his destiny often on the road he takes to avoid it.
489.author: Unknown

490.quote: One monk said to the other, The fish has flopped out of the net! How will it live? The other said, When you have gotten out of the net, I'll tell you.
490.author: Unknown

491.quote: Only that in you which is me can hear what I'm saying.
491.author: Baba Ram Dass

492.quote: Only those who leisurely approach that which the masses are busy about can be busy about that which the masses take leisurely.
492.author: Lao Tsu

493.quote: Paradise is exactly like where you are right now ... only much, much better.
493.author: Laurie Anderson

494.quote: Perfection is reached, not when there is no longer anything to add, but when there is no longer anything to take away.
494.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

495.quote: Perhaps the biggest disappointments were the ones you expected anyway.
495.author: Unknown

496.quote: Philosophy will clip an angel's wings.
496.author: John Keats

497.quote: Push where it gives and scratch where it itches.
497.author: Unknown

498.quote: Reality always seems harsher in the early morning.
498.author: Unknown

500.quote: Reality is bad enough, why should I tell the truth?
500.author: Patrick Sky

501.quote: Reality is for people who lack imagination.
501.author: Unknown

502.quote: Reality is just a convenient measure of complexity.
502.author: Alvy Ray Smith

503.quote: Reality is just a crutch for people who can't handle science fiction.
503.author: Unknown

504.quote: Reality is nothing but a collective hunch.
504.author: Lily Tomlin

505.quote: Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away.
505.author: Philip K. Dick

506.quote: Remember, Grasshopper, falling down 1000 stairs begins by tripping over the first one.
506.author: Confusion

507.quote: Rule of Life #1...Never get separated from your luggage.
507.author: Unknown

508.quote: Seeing is believing. You wouldn't have seen it if you hadn't believed it.
508.author: Unknown

509.quote: Since everything in life is but an experience perfect in being what it is, having nothing to do with good or bad, acceptance or rejection, one may well burst out in laughter.
509.author: Long Chen Pa

510.quote: So little time, so little to do.
510.author: Oscar Levant

511.quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
511.author: Seneca

512.quote: Sometimes you get an almost irresistible urge to go on living. Superstition, idolatry, and hypocrisy have ample wages, but truth goes a-begging.
512.author: Martin Luther

513.quote: The absurd is the essential concept and the first truth.
513.author: A. Camus

514.quote: The best you get is an even break.
514.author: Franklin Adams

515.quote: The chain which can be yanked is not the eternal chain.
515.author: G. Fitch

516.quote: The chief cause of problems is solutions.
516.author: Eric Sevareid

517.quote: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.
517.author: Alfred Adler

518.quote: The days are all empty and the nights are unreal.
518.author: Unknown

520.quote: The farther you go, the less you know.
520.author: Lao Tsu, Tao Te Ching

521.quote: The final delusion is the belief that one has lost all delusions.
521.author: Maurice Chapelain, Main courante

522.quote: The first requisite for immortality is death.
522.author: Stanislaw Lem

523.quote: The greatest griefs are those we cause ourselves.
523.author: Sophocles

524.quote: The longest part of the journey is said to be the passing of the gate.
524.author: Marcus Terentius Varro

525.quote: The major sin is the sin of being born.
525.author: Samuel Beckett

526.quote: The more laws and order are made prominent, the more thieves and robbers there will be.
526.author: Lao Tsu

527.quote: The more you complain, the longer God lets you live.
527.author: Unknown

528.quote: The moss on the tree does not fear the talons of the hawk.
528.author: Unknown

529.quote: The most costly of all follies is to believe passionately in the palpably not true. It is the chief occupation of mankind.
529.author: H. L. Mencken

530.quote: The only difference between a rut and a grave is their dimensions.
530.author: Unknown

531.quote: The optimist thinks that this is the best of all possible worlds, and the pessimist knows it.
531.author: J. Robert Oppenheimer, Bulletin of Atomic Scientists

532.quote: The Poems, all three hundred of them, may be summed up in one of their phrases: Let our thoughts be correct.
532.author: Confucius

533.quote: The price of success in philosophy is triviality.
533.author: C. Glymour.

534.quote: The questions remain the same. The answers are eternally variable.
534.author: Unknown

535.quote: The race is not always to the swift, nor the battle to the strong, but that's the way to bet.
535.author: Damon Runyon

536.quote: The root of all superstition is that men observe when a thing hits, but not when it misses.
536.author: Francis Bacon

538.quote: The soul would have no rainbow had the eyes no tears.
538.author: Unknown

539.quote: The state of innocence contains the germs of all future sin.
539.author: Alexandre Arnoux, Etudes et caprices

540.quote: The true way goes over a rope which is not stretched at any great height but just above the ground. It seems more designed to make people stumble than to be walked upon.
540.author: Franz Kafka

541.quote: The truth is rarely pure, and never simple.
541.author: Oscar Wilde

542.quote: The truth is what is; what should be is a dirty lie.
542.author: Lenny Bruce

543.quote: The truth of a thing is the feel of it, not the think of it.
543.author: Stanley Kubrick

544.quote: The truth you speak has no past and no future. It is, and that's all it needs to be.
544.author: Unknown

545.quote: There are no accidents whatsoever in the universe.
545.author: Baba Ram Dass

546.quote: There are no winners in life, only survivors.
546.author: Unknown

547.quote: There are ten or twenty basic truths, and life is the process of discovering them over and over and over.
547.author: David Nichols

548.quote: There is more to life than increasing its speed.
548.author: Mahatma Gandhi

549.quote: There is no comfort without pain; thus we define salvation through suffering.
549.author: Cato

550.quote: There is no cure for birth and death other than to enjoy the interval.
550.author: George Santayana

551.quote: There is no sin but ignorance.
551.author: Christopher Marlowe

553.quote: To get something clean, one has to get something dirty. To get something dirty, one does not have to get anything clean.
553.author: Unknown

554.quote: To give happiness is to deserve happiness.
554.author: Unknown

555.quote: To give of yourself, you must first know yourself.
555.author: Unknown

556.quote: To have died once is enough.
556.author: Publius Vergilius Maro (Virgil)

557.quote: To lead people, you must follow behind.
557.author: Lao Tsu

558.quote: Truth has no special time of its own. Its hour is now...always.
558.author: Albert Schweitzer

559.quote: Truth is hard to find and harder to obscure.
559.author: Unknown

560.quote: Truth never comes into the world but like a bastard, to the ignominy of him that brought her birth.
560.author: Milton

561.quote: Waste not fresh tears over old griefs.
561.author: Euripides

562.quote: We can embody the truth, but we cannot know it.
562.author: Yates

563.quote: We have nowhere else to go... this is all we have.
563.author: Margaret Mead

564.quote: We have only two things to worry about: That things will never get back to normal, and that they already have. We have reason to be afraid. This is a terrible place.
564.author: John Berryman

565.quote: We rarely find anyone who can say he has lived a happy life, and who, content with his life, can retire from the world like a satisfied guest.
565.author: Quintus Horatius Flaccus (Horace)

567.author: We're mortal...which is to say, we're ignorant, stupid, and sinful --

568.quote: but those are only handicaps. Our pride is that nevertheless, now and then, we do our best. A few times we succeed. What more dare we ask for?
568.author: Ensign Flandry

569.quote: Well, you know, no matter where you go, there you are.
569.author: Buckaroo Banzai

570.quote: Well, Brahma said, even after ten thousand explanations, a fool is no wiser, but an intelligent man requires only two thousand five hundred.
570.author: The Mahabharata.

571.quote: What does not destroy me, makes me stronger.
571.author: Nietzsche

572.quote: What makes the universe so hard to comprehend is that there's nothing to compare it with. What sane person could live in this world and not be crazy?
572.author: Ursula K. LeGuin

573.quote: What we Are is God's gift to us. What we Become is our gift to God. Whatever occurs from love is always beyond good and evil.
573.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

574.quote: Whatever you do will be insignificant, but it is very important that you do it.
574.author: Gandhi

575.quote: When it's dark enough you can see the stars.
575.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,

576.quote: When the speaker and he to whom he is speaks do not understand, that is metaphysics.
576.author: Voltaire

577.quote: When the wind is great, bow before it; when the wind is heavy, yield to it.
577.author: Unknown

578.quote: When you die, you lose a very important part of your life.
578.author: Brooke Shields

579.quote: Who does not trust enough will not be trusted.
579.author: Lao Tsu

580.quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do with what you know.
580.author: J. Winter Smith

581.quote: Wisdom is rarely found on the best-seller list.
581.author: Unknown

582.quote: [Wisdom] is a tree of life to those laying hold of her, making happy each one holding her fast.
582.author: Proverbs 3:18, NSV

583.quote: With listening comes wisdom, with speaking repentance.
583.author: Unknown

584.quote: Yes, but which self do you want to be?
584.author: Unknown

585.quote: You can always pick up your needle and move to another groove.
585.author: Tim Leary

586.quote: You can get *anywhere* in ten minutes if you drive fast enough.
586.author: Unknown

587.quote: You can never tell which way the train went by looking at the tracks.
587.author: Unknown

588.quote: You can no more win a war than you can win an earthquake.
588.author: Jeannette Rankin

589.quote: You can observe a lot just by watching.
589.author: Yogi Berra

590.quote: You can only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
590.author: Unknown

591.quote: You can't get there from here.
591.author: Unknown

592.quote: You can't mend a wristwatch while falling from an airplane.
592.author: Unknown

593.quote: You can't push on a string.
593.author: Unknown

594.quote: You can't run away forever, But there's nothing wrong with getting a good head start.
594.author: Jim Steinman, Rock and Roll Dreams Come Through

595.quote: You can't survive by sucking the juice from a wet mitten.
595.author: Charles Schulz

596.quote: You can't take it with you...especially when crossing a state line.
596.author: Unknown

597.quote: You climb to reach the summit, but once there, discover that all roads lead down.
597.author: Stanislaw Lem, The Cyberiad

598.quote: You have all eternity to be cautious in when you're dead.
598.author: Lois Platford

599.quote: You have to run as fast as you can just to stay where you are. If you want to get anywhere, you'll have to run much faster.
599.author: Lewis Carroll

600.quote: You will always find something in the last place you look.
600.author: Unknown

601.quote: Your happiness is intertwined with your outlook on life.
601.author: Unknown

602.quote: Your mind understands what you have been taught; your heart, what is true.
602.author: Unknown

603.quote: Your picture of the world often changes just before you get it into focus.
603.author: Unknown

605.quote: You may be marching to the beat of a different drummer, but you're still in the parade.
605.author: Unknown

606.quote: The universe is made of stories, not of atoms.
606.author: Muriel Rukeyser

607.quote: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.
607.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

608.quote: There is a secret person undamaged within every individual.
608.author: Paul Shepard

609.quote: We are governed not by armies and police but by ideas.
609.author: Mona Caird, 1892

610.quote: The first rule of all intelligent tinkering is to keep all the parts.
610.author: Aldo Leopold, quoted in Donald Wurster's Nature's Economy

611.quote: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
611.author: Mahatma Gandhi

612.quote: The words fly away, the writings remain.
612.author: Unknown

613.quote: I am what you will be; I was what you are.
613.author: Unknown

615.quote: Perhaps the remembrance of these things will prove a source of future pleasure.
615.author: Virgil

616.quote: Anyone who understands everything that comes out of fortune probably has a problem
616.author: Unknown

617.quote: If a million people say a foolish thing, it is still a foolish thing.
617.author: Anatole France

618.quote: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life
618.author: Steve Jobs
